ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: English reading and writing skills, especially legal English.

formal writing skill
representative expression
how to read classic sentence
I learned how to write essay and other legal documents. That experience was really good.
Technique for precise writing; reading strategy; how to write office memo
I improved my written skills. By doing so, I can now to communicate in a better way with my clients.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: content, teaching method, faculty

weaknesses: No more improvement.
ambiguity of instruction in class
I am very satisfied with this course. She gave us a lot of feedback, which was the strongest point of this course.
Getting familiar with various legal documents

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. The syllable of the course is well-designed, and Professor Susan attached great efforts improving the content of the course. She will always update cases and materials, trying best to make every class rich and abundant.
Absolutely yes.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Disagree
Neutral
Disagree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: Fluent writing with no blocks.
I will use the skill for getting masters degrees of law.
I will attend LL.M course in Berkeley Law, so I will use this knowledge there.
I will employ what I learned when I work in private practice.
